intro: Gonolobus melinii, commonly known as the yellow false indigo, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features trifoliate leaves with a serrated margin and produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Gonolobus melinii is often found in wetlands, streambanks, and other riparian habitats.
